class ProjectTab(TabPage):
    """
    A widget for managing projects: opening, creating, and validating project settings.
    **Methods**:
    """

    def __init__(self, main, name):
        """
        Initialize

        Args:
            main (MainClass): Main application class reference.
            name (str): Name of the widget.
        """
        self.new_button , self.recent_button , self.open_button = None, None, None
        self.status = "Project Opened"

        # Set up display formats for the settings that this tab uses
        # Regex will highlight any text containing "missing" or "error"
        formats = {
            "error": {
                "STATUS": ("Status", "read_only", r'^(?!.*\b(missing|error)\b).*', 600),
                "PROJECT": ("Project", "read_only", None, 600),
                "FOLDER": ("Folder", "read_only", r'^(?!.*\b(missing|error)\b).*', 600),
                "SETTINGS": ("Settings", "read_only", r'^(?!.*\b(missing|error)\b).*', 600),
                "COLORFILE": ("Color File", "read_only", r'^(?!.*\b(missing|error)\b).*', 600),
                "MAKEFILE": ("Makefile", "read_only", r'^(?!.*\b(missing|error)\b).*', 600),
                "SCRIPT": ("Script", "read_only", r'^(?!.*\b(missing|error)\b).*', 600),
            }, "basic": {
                "STATUS": ("Status", "read_only", None, 600),
                "PROJECT": ("Project", "read_only", None, 600),
                "FOLDER": ("Folder", "read_only", None, 600),
            }
        }

        # Widget for displaying settings
        mode = "basic"
        self.settings_widget = SettingsWidget(main.project, formats, mode)
        super().__init__(
            main, name, on_exit_callback=None, on_enter_callback=self.settings_widget.display
        )

        # Setup buttons - open, recent, new
        self.open_button = create_button("Open", self.open_project_dialog, True, self)
        self.recent_button = create_button("Open Recent", self.open_recent_dialog, False, self)
        self.new_button = create_button("New", self.create_new_project, False, self)

        button_layout = QHBoxLayout()
        button_layout.addWidget(self.open_button)
        button_layout.addWidget(self.recent_button)
        button_layout.addWidget(self.new_button)

        # Instructions
        if self.main.app_config["INSTRUCTIONS"] == "show":
            instructions = get_instructions(self.tab_name, (mode == "basic"))
            title = self.tab_name
        else:
            instructions, title = None, None

        self.create_page(
            widgets=[self.settings_widget, button_layout, expanding_vertical_spacer(20)],
            buttons=None, instructions=instructions, title=title
        )



[docs]
    def load_project(self, config_path):
        """
        Load the project environment after selection or creation.

        Args:
            config_path (str): Path to the project configuration file.
        """
        if config_path:
            self.main.project.load(config_path)

            if self.main.project.error:
                self.settings_widget.change_mode("error")
            else:
                self.settings_widget.change_mode("basic")

                res = self.main.load_all_tabs()
                if not res:
                    print("Error loading project tabs")
                    self.settings_widget.clear_layout()
                    self.settings_widget.mode = "error"
                    self.settings_widget.display()
                    self.main.project.error = True
                else:
                    self.main.project.error = False
                    self.main.set_tabs_available(True, [])

    def open_project_dialog(self):
        """Open a file dialog to select a project configuration file."""

            f"Config Files (*{ProjectData.file_suffix['config']})"
        )
        self.status = "Project Opened"
        self.load_project(config_file_path)

[docs]
    def create_new_project(self):
        """Create a new project and open it."""
        QMessageBox.information(
            self, "New Project", "Create a new folder in the next dialog and open it."
        )

        directory = self.show_file_dialog("directory", "Select Folder for New Project")
        if directory:
            region = os.path.basename(directory)
            config_file_path = os.path.join(
                directory, f"{region}{ProjectData.file_suffix['config']}"
                )
            dem_proxy_path = os.path.join(directory, f"{region}{ProjectData.file_suffix['dem']}")
            ramp_file_path = os.path.join(
                directory, f"{region}{ProjectData.file_suffix['color_ramp']}"
                )

            if os.path.exists(config_file_path) or os.path.exists(ramp_file_path):
                QMessageBox.warning(
                    self, "Error",
                    f"Config file or ramp file already exists in {directory}.\nPlease choose a "
                    f"different folder."
                )
                return

            makefile_file_path = os.path.join(directory, "Makefile")
            if not os.path.exists(makefile_file_path):
                create_file_from_resource("Makefile", makefile_file_path)

            create_file_from_resource(
                f"default{ProjectData.file_suffix['config']}", config_file_path
            )
            create_file_from_resource(
                f"default{ProjectData.file_suffix['color_ramp']}", ramp_file_path
            )

            # Create empty DEM config as a placeholder
            touch_file(dem_proxy_path)

            self.status = "Project Created"
            self.load_project(config_file_path)





[docs]
    def show_file_dialog(self, dialog_type, title, file_type_filter=""):
        """
        Show a file or directory dialog based on the dialog_type.

        Args:
            dialog_type (str): Type of dialog ("open_file", "recent_file", "directory").
            title (str): Title of the dialog.
            file_type_filter (str): Filter for file types.

        Returns:
            str: The selected file or directory path, or None if cancelled.
        """
        if dialog_type == "open_file":
            return QFileDialog.getOpenFileName(self, title, "", file_type_filter)[0]
        elif dialog_type == "recent_file":
            recent_files = self.main.project.recent_files.items()
            if not recent_files:
                QMessageBox.warning(self, "Recent Files", "No recent files found.")
                return None
            return self.show_list_dialog(title, recent_files)
        elif dialog_type == "directory":
            return QFileDialog.getExistingDirectory(
                self, title, "", options=QFileDialog.Option.ShowDirsOnly
            )
        return None

def touch_file(filename):
    """
    Set the file's modification and access time to the current time.

    Args:
        filename (str): Path to the file.
    """
    with open(filename, 'a'):
        os.utime(filename, None)






[docs]
def script_available(script_name):
    """
    Check if a script file is available on the user's PATH.

    Args:
        script_name (str): Name of the script file.

    Returns:
        bool: True if the script is available, False otherwise.
    """
    # Get the list of directories in the user's PATH environment variable
    path_dirs = os.getenv('PATH', '').split(os.pathsep)

    # Check each directory for the script file
    for directory in path_dirs:
        script_path = os.path.join(directory, script_name)
        if os.path.isfile(script_path) and os.access(script_path, os.X_OK):
            return True
    return False

class ProjectData(DataManager):
    """
    Manage project data, including opening a project and paths to project files
    """
    file_suffix = {
        "color_ramp": "_color_ramp.txt", "config": "_relief.cfg", "dem": "_DEM_trigger.cfg"
    }

    def __init__(self, main):
        """
        Initialize ProjectData.

        Args:
            main (MainClass): Main application class reference.
        """
        super().__init__()
        self.main = main
        self._data = {}
        self.project_directory, self.color_file_path, self.makefile_path = None, None, None,
        self.error = False
        self.recent_files = RecentFiles()
        self.recent_files.load(str(app_files_path("recent_files.pkl")))
        self.region = None

    def _load_data(self, _):
        """ Update project data and statuses."""
        data = {
            "STATUS": "Project Opened", "PROJECT": self.region, "FOLDER": self.project_directory,
            "SETTINGS": self.main.config.file_path, "COLORFILE": self.color_file_path,
            "MAKEFILE": self.makefile_path, "SCRIPT": 'color_relief.sh'
        }
        return data

    def set_error(self, message):
        """ Set Project error message """
        self._data["STATUS"] = message
        self.error = True



    def _save_data(self, f, data):
        pass



[docs]
    def load(self, config_path):
        """
        Load project configuration and update internal data.

        Args:
            config_path (str): Path to the project configuration file.
        """
        try:
            self.main.config.load(config_path)
        except Exception as e:
            self.error = True
            self._data["STATUS"] = f"{e}"
            return False

        self.region = os.path.basename(config_path).replace(ProjectData.file_suffix["config"], "")
        self.project_directory = os.path.dirname(config_path)
        self.color_file_path = os.path.join(
            self.project_directory, os.path.basename(config_path).replace(
                ProjectData.file_suffix["config"], ProjectData.file_suffix["color_ramp"]
            )
        )
        self.makefile_path = os.path.join(
            os.path.dirname(self.project_directory), "Makefile"
        )

        # Update recent_files
        self.recent_files.add(config_path)

        # Load and verify data
        self._data = self._load_data(None)
        self.print_files(config_path)
        self.error = not self.verify(["SETTINGS", "COLORFILE", "MAKEFILE"], ["SCRIPT"], "FOLDER", )
        if self.error:
            self._data["STATUS"] = "Files missing"
            return False
        else:
            self._data["STATUS"] = "Project loaded"
            return True

    def print_files(self, config_path):
        print(f"\nProject config file: {config_path} ")
        print(f"Color definition file: {self.color_file_path} ")
        print(f"Makefile: {self.makefile_path} ")
        print(f"Color relief script: color_relief.sh ")

    def get_target(self, name, preview_mode, layer):
        preview = "_prv" if preview_mode else ""
        return f"{self.region}_{layer}{preview}_{name}.tif"

    def get_layer(self):
        # Set preview target and full path
        selection = self.main.config["LAYER"]
        # Get the name for the selected layer
        return self.main.config[f"NAMES.{selection}"]





[docs]
    def verify(self, file_keys, script_keys, folder_keys):
        """
        Verify the presence of required files and scripts and update status accordingly.
        Returns:
            bool: True if the files are present, False otherwise.
        """
        file_error = False

        for name, value in self._data.items():
            if name in file_keys:
                if not value or not os.path.isfile(value):
                    self._data[name] = f"{value} is missing"
                    file_error = True
            elif name in folder_keys:
                if not value or not os.path.isdir(value):
                    self._data[name] = f"{value} is missing"
                    file_error = True
            elif name in script_keys:
                if not script_available(value):
                    self._data[name] = f"{value} script missing"
                    file_error = True

        return not file_error

    def get_proxy_path(self):
        """
        Return path for Config file proxy
        """
        layer = self.main.project.get_layer()
        target = f"{self.main.project.region}_{layer}_DEM_trigger.cfg"
        return str(Path(self.main.project.project_directory) / target)






def _read_resource(resource_name):
    """
    Read the content of a resource file.
    Args:
        resource_name (str): The name of the resource to read.

    Returns:
        str: The content of the resource file.
    """
    with pkg_resources.open_text(resources, resource_name) as resource:
        return resource.read()


def _create_file(target_path, file_data):
    """
    Create a file based on the provided data.

    Args:
        target_path (str): The path to the file to be created.
        file_data (str): The data to write to the file.
    """
    try:
        with open(target_path, 'w') as file:
            file.write(file_data)
    except IOError as e:
        QMessageBox.warning(None, "Error", f"Failed to create {target_path}: {e}")




[docs]
def create_file_from_resource(
        resource_name, target_path, replace_text=None, new_text=None
):
    """
    Create a file from a resource template, optionally replacing text.

    Args:
        resource_name (str): The name of the resource to read.
        target_path (str): The path where the file should be created.
        replace_text (str, optional): The text to be replaced in the resource.
        new_text (str, optional): The text to replace replace_text with.
    """
    file_data = _read_resource(resource_name)
    if replace_text and new_text:
        file_data = file_data.replace(replace_text, new_text)
    _create_file(target_path, file_data)

def app_files_path(filename):
    """
    Determine the platform-appropriate path for app files.
    """
    app_name = "ColorReliefEditor"
    config_dir = user_config_dir(app_name)
    os.makedirs(config_dir, exist_ok=True)
    return os.path.join(config_dir, filename)
